title: Acid resistance
data:
**[English]()**

 • [한국어](/wiki/Acid_resistance/ko "Acid resistance/ko")

**Acid resistance** is a [property](/wiki/Property "Property") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")* and protects against [acid](/wiki/Acid "Acid") damage.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Sources](#Sources)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 Variants](#Variants)

  - [3.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [3.2 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [3.3 FIQHack](#FIQHack)
  - [3.4 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

## Sources

Acid resistance can be obtained by wearing [yellow dragon scales](/wiki/Yellow_dragon_scales "Yellow dragon scales"), [yellow dragon scale mail](/wiki/Yellow_dragon_scale_mail "Yellow dragon scale mail") or an [alchemy smock](/wiki/Alchemy_smock "Alchemy smock"). It can also be obtained by [polymorphing](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") into any acidic monster, as they are the only monsters to have the [intrinsic](/wiki/Intrinsic "Intrinsic") property.

Acid resistance does not protect your equipment against acidic erosion – this is done by [corrodeproofing](/wiki/Corrodeproof "Corrodeproof") it.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

You may gain temporary acid resistance by eating the following corpses: [acid blob](/wiki/Acid_blob "Acid blob"), [spotted jelly](/wiki/Spotted_jelly "Spotted jelly"), [ochre jelly](/wiki/Ochre_jelly "Ochre jelly"), [yellow dragon](/wiki/Yellow_dragon "Yellow dragon"), [green mold](/wiki/Green_mold "Green mold"), [black naga](/wiki/Black_naga "Black naga"), [green slime](/wiki/Green_slime "Green slime"), [Chromatic Dragon](/wiki/Chromatic_Dragon "Chromatic Dragon").

Extrinsic sources of acid resistance also protect your inventory from acid damage 99⁄100 of the time.

## Strategy

Sources of acid damage are as uncommon as acid resistance itself - even in scenarios where it can do significant damage, you can often easily avoid it by other methods, e.g. ranged attacks for acidic passives, and [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") for acid breath. Yellow dragon scales may still be worthwhile for pets and polyforms with multiple hit dice, particularly [mind flayers](/wiki/Mind_flayers "Mind flayers").

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit 0891ef4](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/0891ef4e22ccb56bacd41ce302d4178c1c6525aa), monsters now gain acid resistance from a worn alchemy smock, allowing for more variety in equipping humanoid pets. Additionally, yellow dragon scale mail also grants resistance to stoning.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), the alchemy smock has been replaced by the [lab coat](/wiki/Lab_coat "Lab coat"), which also provides this extrinsic as well as [MC](/wiki/MC "MC")3. Some new monsters deal massive amounts of acid damage, most notoriously the [giant shoggoth](/wiki/Giant_shoggoth "Giant shoggoth"), making this property more desirable for an ascension kit. Though still not a must-have, a player who has [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance"), [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection"), [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance"), and [magic cancellation](/wiki/Magic_cancellation "Magic cancellation") through other means may opt for a lab coat or yellow dragon scale mail just to be on the safe side.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), [chromatic dragon scales](/wiki/Chromatic_dragon_scales_\(UnNetHack\) "Chromatic dragon scales (UnNetHack)") and [chromatic dragon scale mail](/wiki/Chromatic_dragon_scale_mail_\(UnNetHack\) "Chromatic dragon scale mail (UnNetHack)") provide acid resistance among numerous other extrinsics.

### FIQHack

In [FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack"), extrinsic acid resistance protects your items from corrosion.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), due to the presence of monsters such as [acid spheres](/index.php?title=Acid_sphere\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Acid sphere (page does not exist)") and buffs to existing acidic monsters along with the addition of the highly-damaging [acid blast](/index.php?title=Acid_blast\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Acid blast (page does not exist)") [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell"), sources of acid resistance such as yellow dragon scales and scale mail are far more valuable. [Dragonbane](/wiki/Dragonbane "Dragonbane") is changed to a pair of [dragonhide gauntlets](/wiki/Leather_gloves "Leather gloves") that provide acid resistance in addition to the standard [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") and warning of dragons, making it a highly sought-after [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") for most players.

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Acid resistance

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 한국어

Acid resistance is a property that appears in NetHack and protects against acid damage.

Contents

  • 1 Sources
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 Variants
    • 3.1 SLASH'EM
    • 3.2 UnNetHack
    • 3.3 FIQHack
    • 3.4 EvilHack

Sources

Acid resistance can be obtained by wearing yellow dragon scales, yellow dragon scale mail or an alchemy smock. It can also be obtained by polymorphing into any acidic monster, as they are the only monsters to have the intrinsic property.

Acid resistance does not protect your equipment against acidic erosion – this is done by corrodeproofing it.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

You may gain temporary acid resistance by eating the following corpses: acid blob, spotted jelly, ochre jelly, yellow dragon, green mold, black naga, green slime, Chromatic Dragon.

Extrinsic sources of acid resistance also protect your inventory from acid damage 99⁄100 of the time.

Strategy

Sources of acid damage are as uncommon as acid resistance itself - even in scenarios where it can do significant damage, you can often easily avoid it by other methods, e.g. ranged attacks for acidic passives, and reflection for acid breath. Yellow dragon scales may still be worthwhile for pets and polyforms with multiple hit dice, particularly mind flayers.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Per commit 0891ef4, monsters now gain acid resistance from a worn alchemy smock, allowing for more variety in equipping humanoid pets. Additionally, yellow dragon scale mail also grants resistance to stoning.

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, the alchemy smock has been replaced by the lab coat, which also provides this extrinsic as well as MC3. Some new monsters deal massive amounts of acid damage, most notoriously the giant shoggoth, making this property more desirable for an ascension kit. Though still not a must-have, a player who has magic resistance, reflection, drain resistance, and magic cancellation through other means may opt for a lab coat or yellow dragon scale mail just to be on the safe side.

UnNetHack

In UnNetHack, chromatic dragon scales and chromatic dragon scale mail provide acid resistance among numerous other extrinsics.

FIQHack

In FIQHack, extrinsic acid resistance protects your items from corrosion.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, due to the presence of monsters such as acid spheres and buffs to existing acidic monsters along with the addition of the highly-damaging acid blast monster spell, sources of acid resistance such as yellow dragon scales and scale mail are far more valuable. Dragonbane is changed to a pair of dragonhide gauntlets that provide acid resistance in addition to the standard reflection and warning of dragons, making it a highly sought-after artifact for most players.

Retrieved from "https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Acid_resistance&oldid=165599"

{{languages}}
'''Acid resistance''' is a [[property]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]'' and protects against [[acid]] damage.

==Sources==
Acid resistance can be obtained by wearing [[yellow dragon scales]], [[yellow dragon scale mail]] or an [[alchemy smock]]. It can also be obtained by [[polymorph]]ing into any acidic monster, as they are the only monsters to have the [[intrinsic]] property.

Acid resistance does not protect your equipment against acidic erosion – this is done by [[corrodeproof]]ing it.

{{upcoming|NetHack 3.7.0|You may gain temporary acid resistance by eating the following corpses: [[acid blob]], [[spotted jelly]], [[ochre jelly]], [[yellow dragon]], [[green mold]], [[black naga]], [[green slime]], [[Chromatic Dragon]].

Extrinsic sources of acid resistance also protect your inventory from acid damage {{frac|99|100}} of the time.}}

==Strategy==
Sources of acid damage are as uncommon as acid resistance itself - even in scenarios where it can do significant damage, you can often easily avoid it by other methods, e.g. ranged attacks for acidic passives, and [[reflection]] for acid breath. Yellow dragon scales may still be worthwhile for pets and polyforms with multiple hit dice, particularly [[mind flayers]].

{{upcoming|3.7.0|Per {{commit|0891ef4e22ccb56bacd41ce302d4178c1c6525aa|commit 0891ef4}}, monsters now gain acid resistance from a worn alchemy smock, allowing for more variety in equipping humanoid pets. Additionally, yellow dragon scale mail also grants resistance to stoning.}}

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], the alchemy smock has been replaced by the [[lab coat]], which also provides this extrinsic as well as [[MC]]3. Some new monsters deal massive amounts of acid damage, most notoriously the [[giant shoggoth]], making this property more desirable for an ascension kit. Though still not a must-have, a player who has [[magic resistance]], [[reflection]], [[drain resistance]], and [[magic cancellation]] through other means may opt for a lab coat or yellow dragon scale mail just to be on the safe side.

===UnNetHack===
In [[UnNetHack]], [[Chromatic dragon scales (UnNetHack)|chromatic dragon scales]] and [[Chromatic dragon scale mail (UnNetHack)|chromatic dragon scale mail]] provide acid resistance among numerous other extrinsics.

===FIQHack===
In [[FIQHack]], extrinsic acid resistance protects your items from corrosion.

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], due to the presence of monsters such as [[acid sphere]]s and buffs to existing acidic monsters along with the addition of the highly-damaging [[acid blast]] [[monster spell]], sources of acid resistance such as yellow dragon scales and scale mail are far more valuable. [[Dragonbane]] is changed to a pair of [[Leather gloves|dragonhide gauntlets]] that provide acid resistance in addition to the standard [[reflection]] and warning of dragons, making it a highly sought-after [[artifact]] for most players.
